articles.title: Why North Korea's state media has barely mentioned U.S. killing of Iran's Soleimani
articles.description: The idea that key leaders might be executed is not something that nuclear-armed Kim Jong Un wants to contemplate.

articles.author: Salvador Rizzo
articles.title: Anatomy of a Trump rally: 67 percent of claims are false or lacking evidence
articles.description: The president made 179 factual claims at his longest rally to date. We found that 67 percent were false or unsupported by evidence.
articles.content: The president surpassed 15,400 false or misleading claims as of Dec. 10, according to our database tracking all of his suspect statements. But its worth drilling down on his rallies. Theyve gotten longer over time, and theyre a key part of Trumps reelection b… [+91590 chars]

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: Plane skids off runway in Istanbul, flights suspended
articles.description: A passenger plane has skidded off the runway in the Turkish city of Istanbul, temporarily shutting down the airport
articles.content:
Istanbul governors office said there were no deaths or injuries and all 164 passengers were safely evacuated, according to DHA.
Storms and heavy rain have affected the city and transportation since Sunday night.

articles.title: 6.2 magnitude earthquake hits off western Indonesia coast
articles.description: A strong earthquake hit off western Indonesian coast in the Indian Ocean, but there were no immediate reports of damage
articles.content:
Rahmat Triyono, who heads the earthquake and tsunami center at Indonesias Meteorology, Climatology and Geophysics Agency, said there was no risk of a tsunami from the quake and there were no immediate reports of injuries or damage.

articles.author: Sarah El Deeb | AP
articles.title: Iranian general transformed Syria's war in Assad's favor
articles.description: Iranian general Qassem Soleimani, killed in a U.S. airstrike, was Iran's frontman in Syria and helped turn the tide in that country's civil war
articles.content:
It was a telling episode on who controls Irans policy in Syria.
Irans frontman in Syria since 2011, Soleimani helped turn the tide in the now nearly 9-year-old civil war, intervening to save Assad as armed rebels reached the capital, Damascus, and seized sev… [+5830 chars]

articles.author: Tom Odula | AP
articles.title: 6 dead, including 4 residents, after extremist raid in Kenya
articles.description: A Kenyan government official says four people are dead after a raid by suspected al-Shabab extremists in eastern Garissa County
articles.content:
He said the residents were killed by stray bullets during the fighting.
The al-Qaida-linked al-Shabab has vowed retribution on Kenya for deploying its troops in 2011 to fight the extremist group in neighboring Somalia.

articles.title: Germany to move some troops from Iraq to Jordan, Kuwait
articles.description: Germany plans to temporarily move some of its small troop contingent deployed in Iraq to neighboring Jordan and Kuwait amid tensions over the U.S. killing of a top Iranian general in an airstrike in Baghdad last week
